word: No Light, Trifling Words--The minister of the gospel who is a laborer together with God, will learn daily in the school of Christ. . . .No light, trifling words will fall from his lips; for is he not an ambassador for Christ, bearing a divine message to perishing souls?  All jesting and joking, all lightness and trifling, is painful to the cross-bearing disciple of Christ.--Ev 206, 207.
